page.title: 06PARSONS HALL,IRCHESTER
page.content: The Youth Club at Irchester is held in Parsons Hall which was built in 1952. It has been a canteen,a shoe factory and a Bingo hall. The Youth Club is run by the Irchester Youth Centre Trust Fund.Children between six and thirteen years of age may attend.It costs 20p to get in. There is a large hall for games such as five-a-side football,basketball and hockey, and a stage where you can play snooker and darts.Next to the stage is a pool room with three tables in it. Youth Club starts at 6.00pm and finishes at 7.45pm.After the youngsters have left,the older boys come in and stay until 10.00pm.
